item.title: BMW Vehicle left o/s No 79 left there for over a month, 18th September
item.description:
Resident reporting there is a abandoned vehicle o/s No 79 it has been there for over a month & no one has come back for it. It is parked on the road and needs to be removed as it is obstructing the road for other car users. The make is a dark grey BMW Reg - BW54 YEY. Resident reporting no MOT
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Battle Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: OHV needs cutting back, 18th September
item.description:
Please can the vegetation be cut back on Elmstead Lane opposite 162 for our street cleaning machines. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmstead Lane, Elmstead, London

item.title: Broken glass, 18th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Approach, Marylebone Road, Marylebone, London

item.title: Tree to be planted on verge outside 20 Yester Road, 18th September
item.description:
Has been missing a tree for a while. The verge opposite is getting a new tree as the old one died, so this is a good time to plant here too. The grass is also non-existent following building works and people parking on the verge, so a tree will stop this dangerous behavior. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Yester Road, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Inappropriate political statement, 18th September
item.description:
England flags have been painted on a public utility. Given the current political climate this makes it an unwelcome and antisocial political statement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodland Path, Well Hall, London

item.title: Fly-tipped landscaping waste - Hoblingwell, 18th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leesons Way, St Paul's Cray, London

item.title: 107 regents park road in front of roots cafe on the pavement, 18th September
item.description:
Hi there. This pothole rocks each time it is walked on (which I’m sure you can imagine is often as it’s on the high street). It is becoming increasingly distracting while working from home or even trying to fall asleep at night. Is there possibly anything that can be done to keep it from rocking? Kindest regards, Hunter
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 109, Regent's Park Road, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 107 Regents Park Road, in front of roots cafe, 18th September
item.description:
Manhole has recently been making loud noises every time someone walks by due to being unlevel. We live right above where it is located and it has become quite disruptive. We would appreciate it very much if it could be fixed as soon as possible. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 107, Regent's Park Road, Chalk Farm, London

item.title: On the highway near 83 Dyne Road, 18th September
item.description:

item.title: Dumped Rubbish Bags outside 8 Rainbow Street SE5, 18th September
item.description:
This issue was previously reported under the Flytipping – General category at 19:04 on 15/09/2025, with FixMyStreet reference number 8169324. You have since advised that the matter has been resolved; however, this is incorrect. As of 13:17 on 18/09/2025, the rubbish bags remain in place.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rainbow Street, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown plants on sidewalk, 18th September
item.description:
Overgrown plants on both sides of Crompton street. Stinging nettles on both sides. This is a school route.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Crompton Street, Paddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two large litter bins are causing a mess and stink on the corner of New Globe Walk and Park Street., 18th September
item.description:
Two large litter bins are now permanently stationed on the corner of Park Street and New Globe Walk. They are used by the street cleaners to dispose of their bagged waste and create a huge stink in the area and block street access on the corner. The bins are never cleaned and the street stinks from the leaking bin waste left behind. It is unhygienic and an eyesore.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 62-76, Park Street, Southwark, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Discarded furniture outside for over a week, 18th September
item.description:
Reported this problem with a large amount of debris from fly tipping. Most was picked up this morning. Got a notice that it was resolved but these items as well as large pile of rotting food are still outside. Made another report which also has been marked as fixed. As you can see from the photos I have just taken again, the problem is not fixed. Please help.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 40-60, Woolstaplers Way, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet
